    HERITAGE HALL
    VIDEOS ON
    YOUTUBE

    The Sense of Place explores Talladega’s rich history, offering insight into the events, people, and places that have shaped the community. Through photographs, artifacts, and archival materials, the exhibit captures Talladega’s spirit from its earliest days through periods of change and growth.

     

    Now, the Heritage Hall Museum is expanding the story with a new series of oral history interviews featuring local residents, educators, artists, and community leaders. These personal stories preserve Talladega’s cultural heritage and bring its history to life.

    By collecting these voices, the museum helps ensure future generations connect with the experiences and values that define this unique sense of place.

    PERMANENT COLLECTION

    Gee’s Bend Quilting Workshop – Stitch History with the Masters
     

    Join master quilters MaryAnn and China Pettway of the world-famous Gee’s Bend collective for a hands-on quilting workshop in Talladega, AL! The quilts of Gee’s Bend, Alabama—created by generations of Black women—are celebrated for their bold colors, improvised patterns, and deep cultural significance. Hailed as a cornerstone of American folk art, these quilts blend storytelling, resilience, and beauty in every stitch. In this intimate workshop, you’ll create your own story quilt, learn time-honored techniques, and be part of the living legacy of African American textile art. More...

    Discover Local Arts Spotlights in Talladega


    Explore the rich creative landscape of Talladega through our curated local artist features Talladega and inspiring community art spotlights Talladega museum. From vibrant exhibits to live performances, we bring you the best of Talladega arts and culture highlights.

    Stay connected with upcoming arts and heritage events Talladega and enjoy exclusive artist showcases in Talladega AL. Whether you're a lifelong supporter of the arts or just discovering the scene, our spotlight on Talladega artists offers something for everyone who values creativity, culture, and community.

    HERITAGE HALL SURVEY

    ART IN THE SCHOOLS VIRTUAL
    ART CLASSES

    Art in the Schools is a partnership that brings valuable art enrichment experiences to students through in-school art lessons, KidsART exhibits, and virtual art lessons.

    These visual art lessons are currently available free to the public, making them perfect for home-schooling, after-school creativity, or anyone wanting to learn basic art techniques. Whether you're looking for art education for kids in Talladega, or seeking creative kids workshops near Talladega, these resources are a great starting point.
     

    Through our Art in the Schools initiative and seasonal events like our summer art camp in Talladega County, young artists can explore painting, sculpture, and more. Whether it's a kids painting and sculpture camp or art education for kids in Talladega, our mission is to inspire creativity and build artistic confidence.

     

    Join us for virtual art classes and discover the joy of artistic learning with the Talladega Heritage Hall arts camp experience

    Click here to explore the lessons. New lessons are being added regularly, so be sure to check back often for the latest updates in youth visual arts programming.
